channel.title: Hardware installation quickstart: using a mono cable
channel.description:
Continuing the discussion from [Quick Start Guide](http://community.axoloti.com/t/quick-start-guide/57):
[quote="thetechnobear, post:1, topic:57"] do not use a mono cable, see additional notes [/quote]
Where are the 'additional notes' about not using a mono cable? I guess this reference needs to be fixed (or removed :) )

item.title: Hardware installation quickstart: using a mono cable
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

fixed it, I meant to include something in the hardware docs about it, but forgot to add it

Read full topic
item.source: Hardware installation quickstart: using a mono cable

item.title: Hardware installation quickstart: using a mono cable
item.dc:creator: @raboof Arnout Engelen
item.description:
@raboof wrote:

Yeah, http://community.axoloti.com/t/mixer-clipping-issue/310/4 about sums it up. But it'd be nice to improve the docs

Read full topic
item.source: Hardware installation quickstart: using a mono cable

item.title: Hardware installation quickstart: using a mono cable
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

I couldnt find it either.

But use the search function of the side. It is great and I never searched more than once to find what I need.

As i remember the problem with mono is that it creates some noise on one of the outputs.

Anyway, just get the right cable and it will work

Read full topic
